plotframes

Class PlotFrame

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JInternalFrame
            • plotframes.PlotFrame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class PlotFrame
extends javax.swing.JInternalFrame
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    PlotFrame is the window containing a plot
    Author:
    knoodrake
    See Also:
    Plot, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlotFrame

        public PlotFrame(java.lang.String plotId,
         PlotFrame p)
        This constructor create a new PlotFrame by cloning another. Note that nothing is programmaticaly cloned, it's just that every settings and data sources are copied.
        See Also:
        PlotFrame(String, int, File)

      • PlotFrame

        public PlotFrame(java.lang.String plotID,
         int channel,
         java.io.File file)
        Constructor. Note that most stuff is done in #initialize(String, int, File)
        Parameters:
        plotID - the ID string of the plot, currently also used as the frame title
        channel - the channel initialy used
        file - the datafile initialy used
        See Also:
        PlotFrame(String, PlotFrame)
